# Templates Overview

This section provides ready-to-use templates that ensure consistency and compliance across all GitHub repositories in our organization.

## üìã Available Templates

### Repository Templates
- [README Template](readme-template.md) - Standard structure for repository documentation
- [Repository Checklist](repo-checklist.md) - Pre-creation validation checklist
- [Contributing Guidelines](contributing-template.md) - Instructions for contributors

### GitHub Issue & PR Templates
- [Pull Request Template](pull-request-template.md) - Standard PR description format
- [Issue Templates](issue-templates/) - Bug reports, feature requests, and general issues
- [Access Request Template](access-request-template.md) - Standardized access requests

### Governance & Compliance
- [Data Classification Checklist](data-classification-template.md) - Repository data safety assessment
- [Security Policy Template](security-policy-template.md) - Repository security guidelines
- [Publication Readiness Checklist](publication-checklist.md) - Pre-publication validation
- [Incident Report Template](incident-report-template.md) - For reporting governance violations

### Process Templates
- [Onboarding Checklist](onboarding-checklist.md) - New user setup verification
- [Repository Review Template](repo-review-template.md) - Periodic governance reviews
- [Archival Process Template](archival-template.md) - Repository sunset procedures

## üéØ How to Use Templates

1. **Choose the appropriate template** for your task
2. **Copy the template content** to your repository or issue
3. **Fill in the placeholders** with project-specific information
4. **Remove any sections** that don't apply to your situation
5. **Follow the guidelines** provided in each template

## üîß Customization Guidelines

### Required Elements
Some template sections are **mandatory** and cannot be removed:
- Data classification information
- Security contact details
- Compliance statements

### Optional Elements
Elements marked as "optional" can be:
- Modified to fit your project needs
- Removed if not applicable
- Extended with additional information

### Organization-Specific Placeholders
Replace these placeholders in all templates:
- `{ORG_NAME}` - Your organization name
- `{CONTACT_EMAIL}` - Governance team contact
- `{REPO_NAME}` - Specific repository name
- `{PROJECT_TITLE}` - Project display name

---

## üìù Example README Template

```markdown
# {PROJECT_TITLE}
